chapter.title: Shipping & Receiving (S/R) Module
chapter.para: In this chapter, we describe the Inventory module. This module is responsible for the following key functions:

listitem.para: Issuing Stock to Shipping
Shipping Orders
Receiving Orders

section.title: Shipping
section.para: The shipment of orders is described in this section.

section.title:
packing lists
batch printing of
batch mode
printing packing lists using Packing List Batch
section.para: If you want to print Packing Lists or Sales Order Pick Lists in batch mode--or to gain greater visibility over your Packing and Pick Lists--select the "Packing List Batch" option. The following screen will appear:

note.para: A Sales Order "Pick List" will be printed if the Sales Order does not yet have a Shipment Number associated with it--that is, if no Line Item quantity has been issued to shipping. If stock has been issued to Shipping, then the "Packing List" report definition will be used. The Pick List and Packing List Form assignments are made on the Customer Form Assignments screen.

tip.para: The system includes two alternate Sales Order Pick List report definitions:
The first includes already closed Sales Order Line Items in the report; the other excludes closed Line Items.

section.para: When printing Packing Lists in batch mode, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Display lists selected Orders (i.e., Sales Orders and Transfer Orders).

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to print a copy of the contents displayed on the screen, using the specified parameters.

Select to print packing lists for all Orders in batch list. A Sales Order Pick List will be printed if the Sales Order does not yet have a Shipment Number associated with it--that is, if no Line Item quantity has been issued to shipping. If stock has been issued to Shipping, then the Packing List report definition will be used.
Select to delete Orders from batch printing list once they have been printed.
Select to add a Sales Order to the list of selected Orders.
Select to add a Transfer Order to the list of selected Orders.
Highlight an Order and then select this button to remove the Order from the list.

Highlight an Order, then select this option to print an individual Packing List or Sales Order Pick List for the specified Order. A Sales Order Pick List will be printed if the Sales Order does not yet have a Shipment Number associated with it--that is, if no Line Item quantity has been issued to shipping. If stock has been issued to Shipping, then the Packing List report definition will be used.
Select to automatically update the information displayed in the Packing List batch.
The list will automatically update every 60 seconds if this option is selected.

section.title:
packing lists
batch printing of
batch mode
printing packing lists using
ship vias
printing packing lists by Print Packing List Batch by Ship Via
section.para: If you want to print batches of Packing Lists according to their Ship Via method, select the "Print Packing List Batch by Ship Via" option. The following screen will appear:

mediaobject.caption: Print Packing List Batch by Ship Via

tip.para: If you don"t see any Ship Vias appearing in the Ship Via list, this probably means you don"t have any unprinted Orders on the Packing List Batch. To verify, open the Packing List Batch and check the printed status of the Orders listed there.

section.para: When printing batches of Packing Lists according to their Ship Via, you are presented with the following options:

note.para: The system supports up-to-date shipment tracking with links to the websites of many leading shipping companies (i.e., "Ship Vias").

listitem.para: Specify the Ship Via whose batched Packing Lists you want to print.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without printing a Packing List batch, returning you to the application desktop.
Prints the Packing List batch for the specified Ship Via.

section.title:
shipping
issuing stock to Issue Stock to Shipping
section.para: Once Sales Order (or Transfer Order) Line Items are ready to be shipped, they must be issued to Shipping. To issue Stock to Shipping, select the "Issue Stock to Shipping" option. The following screen will appear:

note.para: Before a Sales Order can be shipped successfully, Sales Account and A/R Account Assignments for the specified Customer must be in place.

section.para: When issuing Stock to Shipping, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Sales Order Number of the Sales Order whose Stock you want to issue to Shipping.
Enter the Transfer Order Number of the Transfer Order whose Stock you want to issue to Shipping.
Displays the Source Warehouse if a Transfer Order is selected.
Displays the Destination Warehouse if a Transfer Order is selected.
Select to ensure you have enough Quantity on Hand of a Line Item prior to issuing Stock to Shipping.

If selected, this option will prevent you from issuing Line Item quantity to Shipping if doing so would force Quantity on Hand for the Item Site to fall below zero. Not selecting this option means issuing Stock to Shipping may drive Item Site Quantity on Hand negative.

Display lists Sales Order Line Items available for Shipping. If the Scheduled Date for an unshipped Line Item is in the future, the line will display in green text. If the Scheduled Date for an unshipped Line Item is not in the future, the line will display in red text. Once shipped, all Line Items revert to black text.
This is an optional field which allows you to issue stock to Shipping using a Bar Code scanner.

Enter a UPC Code for a Sales Order Line Item using a Bar Code scanner--or manually enter the UPC Code. The UPC Code for an Item is stored on the Item master. Once the code is entered, specify a quantity and then select the FIND button to issue the Line Item quantity to shipping. You may also hit the ENTER key on your keyboard to select the FIND button. This field also supports the scanning of Work Order bar codes, if the Work Order is linked to a Sales Order. The Sales Order Number must already be entered for the Work Order scan to be successful. If the scan is not successful, then you know the Work Order does not belong to the Sales Order.

tip.para: Most scanners allow you to change a setting that automatically sends the ENTER command after a scan. This allows keyboard-free entry.

listitem.para: Specify the quantity of Line Items to be issued using a UPC Code. To issue the Line Item quantity to shipping, select the FIND button--or hit the ENTER key on your keyboard to select the FIND button.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without issuing stock to Shipping, returning you to the application desktop.

note.para: If an Order is marked "Ship Complete," you will be prevented from shipping the Order until all Line Item quantities are issued to Shipping.

listitem.para: Select to Ship the specified Sales Order, as described in the Ship Order"Ship Order" section.
Highlight a Line Item, then select this button to issue stock to Shipping. You may also double-click on a Line Item to reach the Issue Stock screen.

note.para:
If an Item issued to Shipping is a
multiple location control
impact on shipping
shipping
MLC impact on Multiple Location Control (MLC) Item, you will be prompted to specify the Location you want to issue stock from.

listitem.para: Highlight a Line Item, then select this button to issue the balance of the Line to shipping.
Highlight a Line Item, then select this button to remove the Line from Shipping, returning the stock to Inventory.

tip.para: If your site integrates UPS WorldShip with the system, you should process Orders in WorldShip after they have been issued to Shipping--but before they have been shipped. For more information, see the UPS WorldShip Integration"Topic: UPS WorldShip Integration" section.

listitem.para: Select to issue all Line Items to Shipping simultaneously.

Compares the UPC Code entered in the "Issue Items Using Barcode" field with the UPC Codes for the listed Sales Order Line Items, then issues to Shipping the quantity specified in the "Qty." field. The FIND button may be selected using your mouse--or by hitting the ENTER key, which corresponds to the FIND button. Because the FIND button corresponds to the ENTER key, you can scan in a UPC Code and then hit ENTER to issue a quantity of one to Shipping. If you prefer, you can scan in a UPC Code and then specify a different quantity before hitting ENTER.

section.para:
shipping
issue line item to To issue a Line Item to Shipping, highlight the Line Item, then select the ISSUE STOCK button. You may also double-click on the Line Item. The following screen will appear:
When issuing a Line Item to Shipping, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Displays Sales Order Number for specified Line Item.
Displays Item Number for specified Line Item.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays Warehouse identified on Sales Order Line Item.
Displays quantity of Item ordered.
Displays quantity of Item already shipped for specified Order.
Displays quantity of Item returned for specified Order.
Displays balance of Line Item remaining to be shipped for specified Order.
Displays quantity of Item at Shipping for specified Order.
Enter the quantity of Items you want to issue to Shipping for specified Order.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without issuing Stock to Shipping, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to issue the specified Line Item quantity to Shipping.
If the specified Item is a Multiple Location Control Item, you will be brought to the "Distribute Stock To/From Warehouse Locations" screen.

section.title:
shipping
maintaining contents at
shipping contents
maintenance of Maintain Shipping Contents
section.para: When Items have been issued to Shipping, you have the ability to maintain these Shipping contents in one central location, by Warehouse. To maintain Shipping contents, select the "Maintain Shipping Contents" option. The following screen will appear:
When maintaining Shipping contents, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to maintain Shipping contents for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose Shipping contents you want to maintain.

Display lists Stock at Shipping based on the specified parameters. This display is a nested list, with a plus ("+") sign located to the far left of the display next to each line that may be expanded to lower levels. By clicking your mouse on a plus sign, you reveal lower levels of information related to the Documents.

note.para: The printed status for a Sales Order at Shipping may be either "No," "Yes," or "Dirty." The first two options indicate whether Shipping Forms have been printed for the Order or not. The Dirty status indicates Shipping contents have changed since Shipping Forms were printed for the Order.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following button is available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without maintaining Shipping contents, returning you to the application desktop.

section.para: Right-clicking on a parent Order in the "Stock at Shipping" list enables you to select from the following menu options:

varlistentry.term: Return ALL Stock Issued to Order

section.para: Before a Sales Order can be shipped successfully, Sales Account and A/R Account Assignments for the specified Customer must be in place.

section.title:
shipping
shipping sales orders Ship Order
section.para: To ship an Order, select the "Ship Order" option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: Before a Sales Order can be shipped successfully, Sales Account and Accounts Receivable (A/R) Account Assignments for the specified Customer must be in place.

section.para: When Shipping an Order, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Order Number of the Sales Order you want to ship.
The browse button located to the right of the field leads to a searchable list of Sales Orders available for Shipping. This option will be disabled if a Transfer Order is specified.
Enter the Order Number of the Transfer Order you want to ship.
The browse button located to the right of the field leads to a searchable list of Transfer Orders available for Shipping. This option will be disabled if a Sales Order is specified.
Displays the Source Warehouse if a Transfer Order is selected.
Displays the Destination Warehouse if a Transfer Order is selected.
Specify this option to select the Sales Order for Billing as soon as it is shipped.

If selected, the Order will appear on the Billing Selections list--making it available to be converted into an Invoice. This option will be selected by default if specified in your system-level configuration. This option will be disabled if a Transfer Order is specified.
Specify this option to automatically create and print an Invoice for the Sales Order as soon as it is shipped.

Selecting this option enables you to bypass the Billing Selection process. Once the Order is shipped, an Invoice will be created and printed. This Invoice will appear on the list of unposted Invoices--making it available for posting. By default, the "Select for Billing" option will also be selected. This option will be disabled if a Transfer Order is specified.
Specify this option to automatically print a Packing List as soon as the Order is shipped.
Select if you want the Transfer Order to be received automatically at the Destination Warehouse as soon as the Order is shipped.
If this option is not used, Transfer Order Items must be received manually at the Destination Warehouse. This option will be disabled if a Sales Order is specified.

tip.para: The system will move Transfer Order Items to the specified Transit Warehouse when the Order is shipped. If the Order is marked to be received immediately, the system will then receive Inventory at the Destination Warehouse.

listitem.para: Displays the name of the Customer to be billed for the Sales Order.
Displays the appropriate Ship-To Address.

tip.para: If your site integrates UPS WorldShip with the system, you should process Orders in WorldShip after they have been issued to Shipping--but before they have been shipped. For more information, see the UPS WorldShip Integration"Topic: UPS WorldShip Integration" section.

listitem.para: Display lists Order Line Items available for Shipping.
Displays the value of the Items being shipped.
The shipment value represents the total of the extended prices for all Items included in the Shipment. The amount does not include freight or Tax.

varlistentry.term:
freight
on sales orders
sales orders
freight charges on Freight

listitem.para: Enter the amount of freight charge to be added to the specified Order. Freight charges may be entered during the creation or modification of an Order--or at the time of shipment.

note.para: The system supports up-to-date shipment tracking with links to the websites of many leading shipping companies (i.e., "Ship Vias").

listitem.para: Specify the Ship Via for the Order.
The Ship Via field supports free-form Ship Vias. If you want to enter a free-form Ship Via, simply type the name of the Ship Via into the field.

tip.para: Get the most up-to-date tracking information directly from the shipper's website by using the "Query Shipment Status" option found in the "Shipments by Sales Order" report. This feature is enabled for a limited number of shipping companies (i.e., "Ship Vias")

listitem.para: Tracking Numbers associated with an Order may be viewed in the Shipments by Sales Order report.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without Shipping the Order, returning you to the application desktop.
Ships the Order, clearing the screen of previously-displayed data.

note.para: If an Order is marked "Ship Complete," you will be prevented from shipping the Order until all Line Item quantities are issued to Shipping.

section.title:
shipping
recalling orders to Recall Orders to Shipping
section.para: If a Sales Order has been shipped in error--or if changes need to be made to an Order prior to shipping--you may recall the Order to Shipping. To recall Orders to Shipping, select the "Recall Orders to Shipping" option. The following screen will appear:
When recalling an Order to Shipping, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to include Invoiced Orders in the display.

This option is only enabled for users assigned the "RecallInvoicedShipment" privilege. Users with that privilege have the ability to recall to Shipping Orders which have already been invoiced. Non-privileged users may not recall invoiced Orders to Shipping. An Order is considered "invoiced" after an Invoice has been created from it from a billing selection. In some cases, it may be desirable to completely back out an Invoice using the following steps: 1) Delete Invoice; 2) cancel billing selection; 3) recall Order to Shipping; 4) return stock to Inventory.
Display lists shipped Sales Orders available for recall.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without recalling the Order, returning you to the application desktop.
Highlight a Sales Order then select this button to recall the Order to Shipping. The Order will now display on the "Ship Orders" screen.

section.title:
shipping records
purging of Purge Shipping Records
section.para: To purge Shipping Records, select the "Purge Shipping Records" option. The following screen will appear:
When purging Shipping Records, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Shipping Records created on or before this date will be purged.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without purging the Shipping Records, returning you to the application desktop.
Purges Shipping Records on and before the specified cutoff date.

section.title:
receiving
from shipping
shipping
receiving purchased items from Receiving
section.para: A Receipt represents the action of receiving and posting Inventory against a given Purchase Order for later Vouchering.

section.title:
receiving
entering of receipts Enter Receipt
section.para: To receive Orders into Inventory, select the "Enter Receipt" option. The following screen will appear:
When receiving an Order, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Order Number of the Purchase Order whose Line Item(s) you want to receive into Inventory.
The browse button located to the right of the field leads to a searchable list of Purchase Orders available for receiving. This option will be disabled if a Transfer Order is specified.
Enter the Order Number of the Transfer Order whose Line Item(s) you want to receive into Inventory.
The browse button located to the right of the field leads to a searchable list of Transfer Orders available for receiving. This option will be disabled if a Purchase Order is specified.
Displays the Source Warehouse if a Transfer Order is selected.
Displays the Destination Warehouse if a Transfer Order is selected.

varlistentry.term: Assign all Lot Controlled Items to single Lot #

listitem.para: Select if you want all the Lot-controlled Items in a Receiving session to be assigned the same Lot Number.

Lot Numbers are assigned when Receipt(s) are posted. This option applies to Lot-controlled Items only. There is no impact on received Items which are not Lot-controlled. For perishable Items, you will also be given the opportunity to enter an expiration date. Expiration dates apply only to Item Sites marked as perishable.
Display lists Order Line Items available for receipt confirmation.

tip.para: Before a Purchase Order can be received successfully, A/P Account Assignments for the specified Vendor must be in place.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without entering a Receipt, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to print the paperwork associated with the specified Order.
Select this button to post the Receipt quantity to Inventory.
Select this button to save the Receipt quantity for posting at a later time. Saved Receipts may be posted later from the List Unposted Receipts screen.

Highlight a Line Item, then select this button to reach the Receipt detail screen. Double-clicking on a Line Item will also bring you to the Receipt entry screen. This option will be disabled if a Transfer Order is specified.
Select to receive all Line Items simultaneously.

note.para:
If the Item you are receiving is a
multiple location control
impact on receiving
receiving
MLC impact on Multiple Location Control (MLC) Item, you will be prompted to specify the Location you want to distribute the stock to.

section.para: To enter Receipt details, highlight a Line Item and select the ENTER RECEIPT button. The following screen will appear:
When entering Receipt details, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Displays the Purchase Order Number specified on the previous screen.
Displays the line number for the specified Purchase Order Item.
Displays the Item Number for the Purchase Order Item.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays the Vendor's Item number for the specified Item.
Displays Vendor's description of specified Item.
Displays the Vendor's Item UOM for the specified Item.
Displays the ratio between Inventory and Vendor Units of Measure.
Enter the date you want the receiving transaction to be posted to the General Ledger.
By default, receipts will be posted on the current day. However, this feature gives you the option to post transactions on an alternate date.
Displays the date the Item is due to be received.
Displays the quantity ordered of the specified Item
Displays the quantity received of the specified Item.
Specify the Line Item quantity you want to receive into Inventory. Depending on how your system is configured, you may or may not be allowed to receive more than the quantity ordered.
If Line Item freight charges were specified when the Line Item was created, then those charges will automatically appear here.
If you receive a partial quantity and decrease the Freight amount accordingly, the system will automatically show the remaining Freight balance due when you go to receive the remaining quantity.
This is a scrolling text field with word-wrapping for entering Notes related Items being received into Inventory.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without receiving any of the Line Item quantity.
Select to receive the specified Line Item quantity.

note.para: For information on the special processes required to receive Lot-controlled Items, see the Receiving Lot/Serial Items into Inventory"Topic: Receiving Lot/Serial Items into Inventory" section in the Inventory Management (I/M) ModuleInventory Management (I/M) Module chapter.

section.title:
receiving
list unposted receipts List Unposted Receipts
section.para: When you are receiving an Order, you have the option to either post it or save it for posting later. If a Receipt is saved for posting later, it will appear on the List Unposted Receipts screen. To access your unposted Receipts, select the "List Unposted Receipts" option. The following screen will appear:

The "Unposted Receipts" screen displays information on all existing unposted Order Receipts, including Order Number, Order Type, Vendor name, Line Item Number, Order due date, Inventory Item Number, Inventory UOM, Vendor Item Number, Vendor UOM, quantity ordered, quantity received, quantity to receive, receipt date, and G/L posted date.

tip.para: You may select multiple Receipts for printing or posting by highlighting them using your mouse--or a combination of your mouse and either the SHIFT or CTRL keys.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Highlight an Order and then select this button to print a copy of the selected Order.
Opens screen for entering a new Receipt.
Enables you to edit Receipts by correcting the received quantity or freight amount. Double-clicking on a Receipt will also bring you to the editing screen.
Highlight a Receipt and then select this button to post the selected Receipt.
Highlight a Receipt and then select this button to remove the Receipt from the list.
Highlight a Receipt and then select this button to reach a read-only view of the original Order Line Item screen.

section.para: Right-clicking on a Receipt in the unposted Receipts list enables you to select from the following menu options:

section.title:
returns
entering at shipping
shipping
entering of returns Enter Return
section.para: Returns are used in the event that Purchase Order Items need to be returned to a Vendor. To enter a Return, select the "Enter Return" option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: Privileged users will be given the option to generate an A/P Credit Memo in the amount of the Return when the Return is posted. This option is available when returning against closed Purchase Order Line Items. Closed Purchase Orders will be reopened automatically in this scenario to allow for future Receipts. If the option is not used--or if a Line Item is not closed at the time of a Return--then the Return may be processed normally from the "Uninvoiced Receipts and Returns" screen.

section.para: When entering a Return, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Purchase Order Number of the Purchase Order whose Line Item(s) you want to return.
Select to include closed Purchase Orders in the list accessible from the "P/O#" field.
Select if you want to print a Return report when the Return is posted.
The report will be printed when you select the POST button.
Enter the Address where the Return should be sent.
By default, the Address used will be the same as the main Vendor Address found on the Vendor master. You may edit the Address information before posting the Return.
Display lists Purchase Order Line Items available for return.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without entering a Return, returning you to the application desktop.
Highlight a Line Item, then select this button to remove the returned Line Item quantity from Inventory.

For privileged users, an A/P Credit Memo may be generated in the amount of the Return when the Return is posted. This option is available when returning against closed Line Items. If used, the Line Item will be automatically reopened to allow for future Receipts. Also, a Return report will be printed if the "Print Return Report" option is selected.
Highlight a Line Item, then select this button to initiate a Return. Double-clicking on a Purchase Order Line Item will also bring you to the Return Item screen.

note.para:
If an Item you are returning is a
multiple location control
impact on receiving
receiving
MLC impact on Multiple Location Control (MLC) Item, you will be prompted to specify the Location you want to issue the stock from.

section.para: To enter Return details, highlight a Purchase Order Item and select the ENTER RETURN button. The following screen will appear:
When entering Return details, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Displays the Purchase Order Number specified on the previous screen.
Displays the Purchase Order Line Item number selected on the previous screen.
Displays the Item Number of the Line Item selected on the previous screen.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Displays the Vendor's Item number for the specified Item.
Displays Vendor's description of specified Item.
Displays the Vendor's Item UOM for the specified Item.
Displays the ratio between Inventory and Vendor Units of Measure.
Displays the quantity ordered of the specified Item.
Specify the quantity of the Item you want to return.
Displays the quantity available to be returned.
The maximum returnable quantity is the original quantity ordered. The system will not allow you to return more than the returnable quantity.
Specify a code to describe the return.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without entering a return for the Purchase Order Line Item, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to return the specified Line Item quantity.

When posting a Return, privileged users will be given the option to generate an A/P Credit Memo in the amount of the Return. This option is available when returning against closed Purchase Order Line Items. Closed Purchase Orders will be reopened automatically in this scenario to allow for future Receipts.

section.title:
forms
for shipping
shipping
forms used in Forms
section.para: Forms used in Shipping are available in the "Forms" section.

section.title:
packing lists
printing of Print Packing List
section.para: To print a Packing List, select the "Print Packing List" option. The following screen will appear:
When printing a Packing List, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: : Enter the Sales Order Number of the Sales Order whose Packing List you want to print.
: Displays the Order Date for the specified Sales Order.
. Name: Displays the Customer Name associated with the specified Sales Order.
. Phone: Displays the Customer's phone number.
: Displays the Purchase Order Number associated with the specified Sales Order.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without printing a Packing List, returning you to the application desktop.
Prints a copy of the Packing List for the specified Sales Order.

section.title:
bills of lading
printing of
shipping forms
printing of Print Shipping Form
section.para: A Bill of Lading is an example of a Shipping Form. To print a Shipping Form, select the "Shipping Form" option. The following screen will appear:
When printing a Shipping Form, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: : Enter the Sales Order Number of the Sales Order whose Shipping Form you want to print.
The browse button located to the right of the field leads to a searchable list of Sales Orders with quantities at Shipping. Only Sales Orders with quantities at Shipping will appear in the list.

note.para: Only Sales Orders which have had Items issued to Shipping may be selected. Once an Order has been shipped, you may no longer select it and print a Shipping Form for it.

listitem.para: Displays the Ship-To Address for the specified Sales Order.
Specify the name of the Shipping Form you want to print.
Specify details for the Shipping Form copies you want to print.
# of Copies: Indicate the number of copies you want to print using the arrow buttons. Information about the specified copies will display below.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without printing a Shipping Form, returning you to the application desktop.
Prints specified number of copies of the Shipping Form for the specified Sales Order.

section.para: To add a Watermark to a Shipping Form, double-click on a copy line. The following screen will appear:
When adding a Watermark to a Shipping Form copy, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Specify the name of the Watermark to be used for the selected copy.
Select to show Prices in the selected copy.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without adding a Watermark, returning you to the previous screen.
Saves the Watermark definition to the selected copy.

section.title:
shipping forms
printing of Print Shipping Forms
section.para: To print multiple Shipping Forms, select the "Shipping Forms" option. The following screen will appear:
When printing multiple Shipping Forms, you are presented with the following options:

varlistentry.term: Print Shipping Forms for new Shipments

listitem.para: : Select to print Shipping Forms for new Shipments.

varlistentry.term: Print Shipping Forms for Changed Shipments

listitem.para: Select to print Shipping Forms for changed Shipments.
Specify details for the Shipping Form copies you want to print.
# of Copies: Indicate the number of copies you want to print using the arrow buttons. Information about the specified copies will display below. To add a Watermark, double-click on a copy line.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without printing Shipping Forms, returning you to the application desktop.
Prints specified number of copies of the Shipping Forms.

section.para: To add a Watermark to Shipping Forms, double-click on a copy line. The following screen will appear:
When adding a Watermark to Shipping Form copies, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Specify the name of the Watermark to be used for the selected copy.
Select to show Prices in the selected copy.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without adding a Watermark, returning you to the previous screen.
Saves the Watermark definition to the selected copy.

section.title:
shipping labels
printing by sales order
sales orders
printing shipping labels for Print Shipping Labels by S/O #
section.para: To print Shipping labels by Sales Order Number, select the "Print Shipping Labels by S/O #" option. The following screen will appear:

mediaobject.caption: Print Shipping Labels by Sales Order Number

section.para: When printing Shipping labels by Sales Order Number, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: : Enter the Sales Order Number of the Sales Order whose Shipping labels you want to print.
Specify the name of the Shipping Label Form you want to print.
Specify the range of Shipping labels you want to print.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without printing any Shipping labels, returning you to the application desktop.
Prints specified number of Shipping label copies for the specified Sales Order.

section.title:
shipping labels
printing by invoice
invoices
printing shipping labels for Print Shipping Labels by Invoice
section.para: To print Shipping labels by Invoice, select the "Print Shipping Labels by Invoice" option. The following screen will appear:
When printing Shipping labels by Invoice, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: : Enter the Invoice Number of the Invoice whose Shipping label you want to print.
Specify the name of the Shipping Label Form you want to print.
Specify the range of Shipping labels you want to print.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without printing any Shipping labels, returning you to the application desktop.
Prints specified number of Shipping label copies for the specified Invoice.

section.title:
receiving labels
printing by p/o
purchase orders
printing receiving labels for Print Receiving Labels by P/O #
section.para: To print Receiving labels by Purchase Order Number, select the "Print Receiving Labels by P/O #" option. The following screen will appear:

mediaobject.caption: Print Receiving Labels by Purchase Order Number

section.para: When printing Receiving labels by Purchase Order Number, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: : Enter the Purchase Order Number of the Purchase Order whose Receiving labels you want to print.
Specify the name of the Shipping Label Form you want to print.
Specify the range of Receiving labels you want to print.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without printing any Receiving labels, returning you to the application desktop.
Prints specified number of Receiving label copies for the specified Purchase Order.

section.title: S/R Reports
section.para: Reports are described in this section.

section.title:
backlog
by item
items
backlog details for Backlog by Item
section.para: To view Backlog by Item, select the "Backlog by Item" option. The following screen will appear:
When displaying Backlog by Item, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Item Number of the Item whose Backlog you want to view.
Inventory Unit of Measure.
Backlog by Item entered on and after this date will be displayed.
Backlog by Item entered on and before this date will be displayed.
Select to include pricing information in the display.
Select to display Backlog by Item for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose Backlog by Item you want to display.

Display lists Backlog by Item, using the specified parameters. If the "Show Prices" option is selected, an additional column showing the amount of the backlog will display. The total backlog will also be shown.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

section.para: Right-clicking on a Sales Order Line Item in the Backlog list enables you to select from the following menu options:

section.title:
backlog
by customer
customers
backlog for Backlog by Customer
section.para: To view Backlog by Customer, select the "Backlog by Customer" option. The following screen will appear:
When displaying Backlog by Customer, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Customer Number of the Customer whose Backlog you want to display.

The browse button located to the right of the field leads to a searchable Customers list. You may also access this list using the keyboard shortcut "CTRL + L". Once a Customer Number is entered, the Customer name and billing address will display. Select the "?" or "$" symbol next to the browse button to view Customer information for the specified Customer. If a Customer's credit is "In Good Standing," the button will feature a black question mark ("?") icon. If the icon turns to an orange dollar sign ("$"), the Customer's credit Status is "On Credit Warning." A red dollar sign ("$") indicates the Customer's credit Status is "On Credit Hold."
Backlog by Customer entered on and after this date will be displayed.
Backlog by Customer entered on and before this date will be displayed.
Select to include pricing information in the display.
Select to display Backlog by Customer for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose Backlog by Customer you want to display.

Display lists Backlog by Customer, using the specified parameters. If the "Show Prices" option is selected, an additional column showing the amount of the backlog will display. The total backlog will also be shown.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to generate the display, using the specified parameters.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

section.para: Right-clicking on a Sales Order Line Item in the Backlog list enables you to select from the following menu options:

section.title:
backlog
by product category
product categories
backlog details for Backlog by Product Category
section.para: To view Backlog by Product Category, select the "Backlog by Product Category" option. The following screen will appear:
When displaying Backlog by Product Category, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to display Backlog for all Product Categories.
Specify Product Category whose Backlog you want to display.

Enter a Product Category pattern to select a range of Product Categories. Refine your search using Regular Expressions, as described in Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions"Topic: Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions".
Backlog by Product Category entered on and after this date will be displayed.
Backlog by Product Category entered on and before this date will be displayed.
Select to include pricing information in the display.
Select to display Backlog by Product Category for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose Backlog by Product Category you want to display.

Display lists Backlog by Product Category, using the specified parameters. If the "Show Prices" option is selected, an additional column showing the amount of the backlog will display. The total backlog will also be shown.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to generate the display, using the specified parameters.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

section.para: Right-clicking on a Sales Order Line Item in the Backlog list enables you to select from the following menu options:

section.title:
backlog
summarized by warehouse
warehouses
backlog summarized by Summarized Backlog by Warehouse
section.para: To view summarized Backlog by Warehouse, select the "Summarized Backlog by Warehouse" option. The following screen will appear:
When displaying summarized Backlog by Warehouse, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to display summarized Backlog by Warehouse for all Customer Types.
Specify Customer Type whose Backlog by Warehouse you want to display.

Enter a Customer Type pattern to select a range of Customer Types. Refine your search using Regular Expressions, as described in Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions"Topic: Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions".
Summarized Backlog by Warehouse entered on and after this date will be displayed.
Summarized Backlog by Warehouse entered on and before this date will be displayed.
Select to include pricing and Cost information in the display.
Select to display summarized Backlog for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose summarized Backlog you want to display.
Select one of the following options to indicate how you want the results to be organized:
Select to order the display by Ship Date.
Select to order the display by Pack Date.
Select to order the display by Sales Order Number.

Display lists summarized Backlog by Warehouse, using the specified parameters. The display is a nested list, with a plus ("+") sign located to the far left of the screen next to each line that may be expanded to lower levels. By clicking your mouse on a plus sign, you reveal lower levels of information related to the Order. If the "Show Prices and Costs" option is selected, additional columns showing sales Price, Cost, and margin will display.

note.para: The Summarized Backlog by Warehouse display is color-coded for ease of use. The following colors are used to describe the backlog status of Sales Order Line Items:
Blue: Order is at Shipping but is not yet shipped
Green: Order has been shipped but is not yet invoiced
Red: Part of the Order has been shipped and invoiced, but Backorder Items still need to be shipped and invoiced
Order has remaining uninvoiced Line Items remain on Backorder
Black: None of the above conditions is true.

listitem.para: Displays the total number of Sales Orders on Backlog.
Displays the total number of Sales Order Line Items on Backlog.
Displays the total number of unshipped Sales Order Line Items on Backlog.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to generate the display, using the specified parameters.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

section.title:
sales orders
shipments of
shipping
sales orders shipped Shipments by Sales Order
section.para: To view shipments by Sales Order, select the "Shipments by Sales Order" option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: Get the most up-to-date tracking information directly from the shipper's website by using the "Query Shipment Status" option in the "Shipments by Sales Order" report.

section.para: When displaying shipments by Sales Order, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter the Sales Order Number of the Sales Order whose shipments you want to display.
Displays the Order Date for the specified Sales Order.
Displays the Customer Name associated with the specified Sales Order.
Displays the Customer's phone number.
Displays the Purchase Order Number associated with the specified Sales Order.
Display lists shipments by Sales Order, using the specified parameters.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

section.title:
shipping
shipments by date Shipments by Date
section.para: To view shipments by date, select the "Shipments by Date" option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: Get the most up-to-date tracking information directly from the shipper's website by using the "Query Shipment Status" option in the "Shipments by Sales Order" report.

section.para: When displaying shipments by date, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Shipments occurring on or after this date will be included in the display.
Shipments occurring on or before this date will be included in the display.
Display lists shipments by date, using the specified parameters.

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to generate the display, using the specified parameters.
